subject: Re: How many tests per test method?
msgSnippet: ... address1, ... String ... locationCode) ... A constructor with 12 parameters!  Wow!  That s going to be a handfull to anyone trying to use it. The number of
messageBody:
Not quite responding to your question, but:

> SubsidiaryPurchaseRecord(String ssn, String name, String
address1,
> String address2, String address3,
> String address4, String address5,
String
> city,
> String state, String zipCode,
> String purchaseAmount, String
locationCode)
>

A constructor with 12 parameters! Wow! That's going to be a
handfull to anyone trying to use it. The number of mistakes clients
(of the object) are going to make, well...

Are you familiar with Refactorings? (http://www.refactoring.com )

A number of refactorings that would help:
Introduce Parameter Object
Remove Parameter
Replace Array with Object
Replace Parameter with Explicit Methods

Another refactoring you may find useful is to replace the list of
Objects (in this case all of the same type -- String), by a Map:
SubsidiaryPurchaseRecord(Map args) {
setSsn(args.get(SSN_KEY));
...
}

> Parameters address2, address3, address4 and address5 may be null.
> However, no other parameter may be null.

How about inserting an Address object?

Regards,

Manuel Amago.
